title: What do people think about African music? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t know about people, but I LOVE IT! There isn’t one sound coming from Mama Africa so your question is too vague, but I’ll share with you the eclectic range of music I love not in any particular order. Hugh Masakela South Africa. (Woman of the Sun) 2. Manu Dibango - Cameroon!!! (Soul Makossa 1973) this song was influential in a lot of American hip hop music!  3. Songhay Blues - Mali.  4. Fatoumata Diawara also from Mali (I think I have a thing for Malian music!)  5. FELA KUTI - Nigerian!!!!!!  6. Femi Kuti - Nigerian. Water No Get Enemy with Bilal, Macy Gray and D’Angelo. The BEST cover of this song!!!  7. Tinariwen - Taureg-Berbers of Northern Mali.  8. Ayo - Nigeria.  9. Mr. Eazi - Nigeria.  10. Oumou Sangaré from Mali. I have listened to his album since the 1990s, I LOVE it!  11. Dawit Tsige - Ethiopia.  12. Yemi Alade - Nigeria.  13. Youssou N’Dour and Baaba Maal - Senegal.  14. Lucky Dube - South Africa.  15. Miriam Makeba - South Africa.

I want to address the question itself first. It is if the African music is not produced by people. Maybe what you wanted to ask was “What do outsiders think about African Music? Is that my shallow take maybe. But i feel it paints a picture as if African music is not produced by people. Which people are you referring to? Let me assume that i have understood you, then African music comes in different genres, its very difficult to understand what you are asking here? There is Zimbabwean music which is very different from Kwasakwasa , there is mbotosha in Malawi, there is kwaito, there is house, There is a Reggae too. Are studying music?
